titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 117
CWG14276

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: Flat Storage Box: 11th Ky Cav (US) Muster Rolls, Bundle 7

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, March 10th, 1865.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 117. }
(Extract.)

29. Leave of absence for thirty days is hereby granted the following officers, paroled Prisoners of War, at the expiration for which they will report in person to the Commanding Officers of Camp Parole nearest the Department or Army in which their regiments may be serving: --
Captain Joshua W. Jacobs, 4th Kentucky Volutneers.
1st Lieutenant Reuben F. Scott, 11th Kentucky Cavalry.

By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIALS:
E D Townsend
Assistant Adjutant General.

War Department
Adj't Generals Office
Washington Mar. 10" 1865
4 Infy
& 11 Cavy
Townsend E. D.
A. A. G.
Order
Granting leave of absence for 30 days to Capt. J. W. Jacobs 4" Ky Vols & 1" Lt. Reuben F. Scott 11" Ky Cav.
Recd A. G. O. Ky 15 Mar. 1865
